nodes.bodyText: @akshaysonvane does this look right to you.
Looks like @timur-isangulov reverted the change. Files changed is 0.

To fix incorrect git commits in a PR, rather than having multiple commits like cleanup or revert, I always use git rebase -i HEAD~10 which opens up an editor and I can reword commit messages. There are others like fixup, which is again something I use to squash commits that are merely corrections of an incorrect commit.
